data.Name: Indicator Solution
data.Description: Indicator solutions are chemical compounds that change color at a specific pH value, used to visually determine the pH of a solution by comparison with a color chart.

data.Name: Indicator Paper
data.Description: Indicator paper, or pH paper, is impregnated with pH-sensitive dyes that change color when dipped into a solution, providing a quick and approximate measure of its pH.

data.Name: Metal Electrode
data.Description: Metal electrodes, such as silver/silver chloride or calomel electrodes, are used as reference electrodes in pH measurement setups involving electrochemical cells.

data.Name: Glass Electrode
data.Description: Glass electrodes are sensitive to hydrogen ions and are widely used in pH meters to provide accurate and continuous pH measurements in various solutions.

data.Name: Sensor
data.Description: pH sensors typically refer to electronic devices that incorporate electrodes (often glass) and other components to measure and output the pH value digitally, suitable for continuous monitoring in diverse environments.
